transcript.text: Government business often involves special laws, regulations and obligations, especially in regard to gifts and entertainment. Select each heading to learn more.

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

tab.tabName: Be sure you know how to identify government officials

tabText.text: A government official is an officer or employee of any entity controlled by a government, including political office holders and managers of state-owned enterprises.

• Elected or appointed officials in any level of government
  • Candidates for political office and political party officials
  • Officers or employees of public international organizations
  • Employees of state agencies, such as customs officials or police
  • Employees of state-controlled enterprises, such as utility companies
  • Employees of government-owned institutions, such as universities or hospitalities
  • Military personnel

• Always obtain approval from the Law department or the Compliance team before using gifts or entertainment to build relationships with current or prospective government customers.
  • Don’t offer or provide anything of value to a government third party with the intention of seeking to influence the official to provide a benefit to Johnson Controls.

• Ensure that gifts to government officials are legal, reasonable and recorded properly and accurately.
  • Any gift to a government official must be pre-approved by submitting a request in advance at http://complianceforms.jci.com
  • Don’t give a gift to a government official close to the submission of a public tender proposal.
  • Don’t give a gift to a government official while regulatory approvals or decisions are pending, when the official has a role or influence in the decision.

• Special rules apply to entertainment involving government officials. Please check the Delegation of Authority (DoA) matrix for your business and ensure you comply with the monetary thresholds and approval process required if you are entertaining government clients.
  • Don’t offer a gift or entertainment to a government third party while decisions are pending regarding contracts or regulatory approvals, when the official has a role or influence in the decision.
  • All entertainment of U.S. Federal Government employees must be pre-approved.
  • The AB pre-approval form is available at http://complianceforms.jci.com
